response.original_title: A Voice to be Heard: Indigenous Australians Elect Members to the National Aboriginal Consultative Committee
response.overview: In 1973, for the first time, Aboriginal people from across Australia directly elected members to the National Aboriginal Consultative Committee (NACC), a body set up to represent their interests to the Federal government, via the newly created Department of Aboriginal Affairs.
response.title: A Voice to be Heard: Indigenous Australians Elect Members to the National Aboriginal Consultative Committee
